body:
@marcaurele please do the honors and merge this one....

P.S. you are going to generate conflicts in my PRs :(

Let's hold on merging this -- we need to run tests across xenserver, vmware and kvm before this may be accepted.
This will potentially break every other outstanding PR, but agree if it needs to be done now is a good time. Let me also find some time to review the PR.

Update - another thing that will cause an issue is, forward merging bugfixes from older releases/branches.
@rafaelweingartner thanks, i will as soon as @rhtyd give me a go
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
@marcaurele do we need `marven-standard` now, can we remove that as well?
@rhtyd it's removed in this PR
Packaging result: ✖centos6 ✖centos7 ✔debian. JID-1657

@marcaurele can you fix packaging for CentOS6 and 7.
CentOS6 packaging fails due to:
+ cp -r 'plugins/network-elements/cisco-vnmc/scripts/network/cisco/*' /jenkins/workspace/acs-pr-centos6-pkg-builder/dist/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/cloudstack-4.12.0.0-shapeblue1671.el6.x86_64/usr/share/cloudstack-common/scripts/network/cisco
cp: cannot stat `plugins/network-elements/cisco-vnmc/scripts/network/cisco/*': No such file or directory
error: Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.lS7NDO (%install)


CentOS7 fails due to:
+ cp -r 'plugins/network-elements/cisco-vnmc/scripts/network/cisco/*' /jenkins/workspace/acs-pr-centos7-pkg-builder/dist/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/cloudstack-4.12.0.0-shapeblue1674.el7.centos.x86_64/usr/share/cloudstack-common/scripts/network/cisco
cp: cannot stat 'plugins/network-elements/cisco-vnmc/scripts/network/cisco/*': No such file or directory
error: Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.mUH4PE (%install)

For your local testing, you can use following docker images:
https://hub.docker.com/r/bhaisaab/centos7-cloudstack-slave/
https://hub.docker.com/r/bhaisaab/centos6-cloudstack-slave/
@rhtyd ack, I will - thanks for the link to the docker images

Trillian test result (tid-2159) Environment: xenserver-71 (x2), Advanced Networking with Mgmt server 7 Total time taken: 22018 seconds Marvin logs: https://github.com/blueorangutan/acs-prs/releases/download/trillian/pr2376-t2159-xenserver-71.zip Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_scale_vm.py Smoke tests completed. 66 look OK, 1 have error(s) Only failed tests results shown below: Test | Result | Time (s) | Test File --- | --- | --- | --- test_01_scale_vm | `Error` | 9.35 | test_scale_vm.py
If tests pass LGTM from me. Should be done as early as possible now we are heading for 4.12 in master
@rhtyd the centos packages have been fixed. Is there a guide on how to use a cs docker image to validate a development, which goes down to building the package and installing it inside the container?

@marcaurele you can kick packages with bo:
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
@rhtyd I thought it was restricted to some users only. Good to know
@marcaurele running a trillian test is restricted, packing is available to everyone.

@marcaurele I'll update packaging docs with the docker images soon, the idea is you run the container, git clone your repo, switch to your branch and run the package build script in packaging directory.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1658

@rhtyd as exchanged, for inclusion into 4.11.0.0 if there would be a 2nd RC. Thanks!

Tests are ok, merging
Vmware test lgtm, @marcaurele please wait for kvm and xenserver tests, which should succeed too, then you can squash merge your changes.

A reminder, the history on Github of some files will look like gone. You have to use your local git to "follow" the files move, see https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/pull/2283#issuecomment-334358004

No regressions seen, merging this based on that and code reviews. This PR has been accepted towards 4.11.0.0, and should make into RC2 as it fixes a borderline blocker issue causing password server to run on ilbm vm.

Test LGTM, merging based on test results and code reviews.

This PR has been accepted towards 4.11.0.0, and should make into RC2 as it fixes a libvirt domain/vm xml spec issue and may cause issue when users are using nuage integration.

@nvazquez should this be seen as a blocker? /cc @DaanHoogland and others
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests

@blueorangutan test
@borisstoyanov a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@rhtyd I don't think it is a blocker. It is new functionality failing, but it is nice to include if it is fixed and we need another RC.
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1663

Please review/lgtm -- @nvazquez @borisstoyanov and others
@blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@rhtyd agree with @DaanHoogland, it is a fix only for new Direct Download functionality

This PR has changes in db upgrade path, to avoid adding a new db upgrade path b/w 4.11.0->4.11.1, and 4.11.1 or 4.11.0->4.12.0 (-snapshot) I think we should consider this merge towards 4.11.0 milestone and to make it into RC2. /cc @wido @rafaelweingartner @nvazquez @mike-tutkowski and others - please review

I did not understand why this change will avoid us having an upgrade path between 4.11 - 4.12.
@DaanHoogland can you provide some extra details here?
@rafaelweingartner this will add complexity that's all, ideally, we should n't (or at least try not to) have db changes in minor/dot releases.
@marcaurele any plan to execute this merge?

Ah, now I got it.
You say, add this now, so we do not need to create upgrade paths for the minor version 4.11.1.0
Is that it?

@rafaelweingartner I think you missed my comment, for changes like this we shouldn't be merging them without test results. We only have test result for vmware, awaiting results for xenserver and kvm. Due to testing of RC1, our Trillian+Jenkins pipelines are full. I checked, smoketests are running for kvm and xenserver now, the results should be available in next 4-6 hours.

@marcaurele can you fix the conflict?
Yes @rafaelweingartner that's it.
I saw it. My question was actually "considering that the tests finished successfully", will this be merged today? Or maybe we have something else to do or check before proceeding to merge.

It seems to be something simple. However, I have no clues why you are changing a field in the database from not null to null able. I checked the Jira ticket, and it is a generic one regarding a feature that you were/are developing.

It is always good to provide these details either in the Jira ticket you create for the PR, or in the PR description itself. I also checked the commit, but it does not provide information regarding the necessity for this change and the impacts it may cause.

Trillian test result (tid-2171) Environment: kvm-centos7 (x2), Advanced Networking with Mgmt server 7 Total time taken: 17383 seconds Marvin logs: https://github.com/blueorangutan/acs-prs/releases/download/trillian/pr2283-t2171-kvm-centos7.zip Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_privategw_acl.py Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_ssvm.py Smoke tests completed. 54 look OK, 0 have error(s) Only failed tests results shown below: Test | Result | Time (s) | Test File --- | --- | --- | ---

@rafaelweingartner I pretty sure it's different than what was actually asked :)
I'll leave the squash merging to @marcaurele after xenserver test (kvm tests LGTM) are back later today (hopefully few hours) and he can fix a merge conflict in `plugins/hypervisors/kvm/src/com/cloud/hypervisor/kvm/resource/LibvirtVMDef.java`

@rafaelweingartner it is a generic quality of settings that they are null able. I booboo'd here by making them non null. The code is really just part of the general functionality.

@rhtyd I will remove 4.11.1 milestone as it would have to be a alter table statement if it needs to go in there.
@rhtyd rebase done, conflict gone

Based on the code and the comments in this PR, LGTM.

Trillian test result (tid-2175) Environment: xenserver-71 (x2), Advanced Networking with Mgmt server 6 Total time taken: 23266 seconds Marvin logs: https://github.com/blueorangutan/acs-prs/releases/download/trillian/pr2283-t2175-xenserver-71.zip Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_deploy_vm_iso.py Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_scale_vm.py Smoke tests completed. 66 look OK, 1 have error(s) Only failed tests results shown below: Test | Result | Time (s) | Test File --- | --- | --- | --- test_01_scale_vm | `Error` | 9.37 | test_scale_vm.py
Tests LGTM, the scale related error is caused due to license issue for xenserver tests. Merging this based on code reviews and test results.
Tests LGTM, Merging this based on code reviews and test result.

@marcaurele with accepting of your PR, can you notify dev@ about your work, request people to rebase their branches and what/how PR authors should fix conflicts, and your suggestion about using `--follow` etc?
@rhtyd what are these "merge 4.11" that are appearing in our commit history?

@rafaelweingartner those are forward merges from 4.11 branch -- we've had three merges on 4.11 since rc1, we want to get them to master branch. Refer for details - https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/CLOUDSTACK/Release+principles+for+Apache+CloudStack+4.6+and+up

hmm... Are you doing via Github the merge forward?
I was under the impression that our merge forward script would provide a bit of details in the commit regarding the "commit"/"PR" it is merging forward.
No, forward merges are done manually. See git histories for past 1-2 months.

Normally, whenever merging forward I use `https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/blob/master/tools/git/git-fwd-merge`. This script creates commits like this one: https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/commit/359d20e8d6d11a992755926a0cf1b1f2a5454487

It inserts in the commit body the message of the commits being merged forward. Otherwise, we get commit message that does not say much.

@mike-tutkowski can you change the base of the PR to 4.11 branch, rebase your PR branch against 4.11?

Update - correction of disks sounds blocker to me, so added the label and milestone to 4.11.0 /cc @wido @DaanHoogland @nvazquez @rafaelweingartner @marcaurele  and others
@jayantpatil1234 can you rebase and fix conflicts?
@rhtyd Will I need to open a new PR to change the base of the PR? Thanks!
@mike-tutkowski can you try the edit button on this pr?
@rhtyd @wido It looks like it took another commit along for the ride when I put this PR on top of a new base. I'll just go ahead and open a new PR and comment on its number here.
Closing this PR in favor of https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/pull/2416
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1664
@blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests

From dev@:

Perhaps your argument against the final keyword is that it should never be used? If so, you and @wido can debate that and let me know which way you’d like this bit of code to end up.

On Jan 20, 2018, at 9:05 AM, Tutkowski, Mike <Mike.Tutkowski@netapp.com> wrote:

It’s pretty much the reason why the final variable exists in Java: to make a variable a constant so no one accidentally changes it. @wido just wanted the code to protect against the variable being changed...that’s all.

On Jan 20, 2018, at 8:25 AM, Rafael Weingärtner <rafaelweingartner@gmail.com> wrote:

Changed by a future programmer that may develop some changes in your code?
Because, if you do not code any other assignment to that variable, it will
never happen.

On Sat, Jan 20, 2018 at 1:16 PM, Tutkowski, Mike <Mike.Tutkowski@netapp.com>
wrote:

@wido just wanted to make sure the Boolean variable didn’t accidentally
get changed later since it’s critical it keep that value.

On Jan 20, 2018, at 8:14 AM, Tutkowski, Mike <Mike.Tutkowski@netapp.com>
wrote:

I made it final per @wido’s comment (in #2415). How’s about you guys
hash it out and get back to me. :)
